{"step_by_step_thinking": "According to the relevant documents, the primary function of the dental pulp is to form dentin (by the odontoblasts). Other functions include: Nutritive: the pulp keeps the organic components of the surrounding mineralized tissue supplied with moisture and nutrients; Protective/Sensory: extremes in temperature, pressure, or trauma to the dentin or pulp are perceived as pain; Defensive/reparative: the formation of reparative or tertiary dentin (by the odontoblasts); Formative: cells of the pulp produce dentin which surrounds and protects the pulpal tissue.", "answer_choice": "B"}
